comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] :-D It's a great photo...not too sure about Ted Hood though.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] I think you may be right. None of the sailors would be wearing ties. Quite a good likeness here - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=8746

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] It's the ears! :P That's what I thought, the clothing seemed off, and there's something quite candid about the photo, not like the others haven't been but it just seemed different. So I thought, what if this is Hood's son Ted? He seems about the right age and then I saw this [http://www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryofnsw/with/4389099096/] pic and thought there was something about his teeth.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
Young Ted hung upside-down on the crane building the Harbour Bridge three years previously -

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryofnsw/3447212244/]

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/71760413@N06] is his grandaughter - she might know ... (message sent).

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/71760413@N06/] Yes you're right he did, I just don't know how he mustered the courage to do that. :S
